name: scrupulously
content:

in a way that is careful to do the morally right thing: She is always scrupulously honest/fair.
in a very careful way that makes sure everything is done exactly as it should be: A hospital must be kept scrupulously clean. See
scrupulous
More examplesFewer examplesHe was scrupulously honest, and always kept his word. What it did mean was that they were scrupulously fair about everything. Officials have remained scrupulously neutral in public. He was scrupulously polite and endlessly patient. All parties, from the foreign editor down, behaved scrupulously.Investigators scrupulously recorded the time their "conversations" began He's a scholar through and through, scrupulously accurate and restrained. A database of detailed medical records for each patient must be created and scrupulously kept up to the minute.He'd planned the attack scrupulously.
